Package javai

Class Node

java.lang.Object
javai.Node
public class Node extends Object
Node class consist of functions and methods for operations on a comprehensive node.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Node()
    This constructs a comprehensive node without manually setting its parameters.
    Node​(double power)
    This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its power.
    Node​(double minPower, double maxPower)
    This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its minimum and maximum power.
    Node​(String functionName)
    This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its comprehensive function.
    Node​(String functionName, double power)
    This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its comprehensive function and power.
    Node​(String functionName, double minPower, double maxPower)
    This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its comprehensive function, and minimum and maximum power.

  • Constructor Details

    • Node

      public Node()
      This constructs a comprehensive node without manually setting its parameters. The node comprehensive function is automatically set to "sum", and the power of the node is automatically configured by setPower().

    • Node

      public Node​(String functionName)
      This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its comprehensive function. The node power is automatically configured by setPower().

    • Node

      public Node​(double power)
      This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its power. The node comprehensive function is automatically set to "sum".

    • Node

      public Node​(double minPower, double maxPower)
      This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its minimum and maximum power. The actual power of the node is automatically configure by setPower(), and the comprehensive function of the node is automatically set to "sum".

    • Node

      public Node​(String functionName, double minPower, double maxPower)
      This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its comprehensive function, and minimum and maximum power. The power of the constructed node is automatically configure by setPower().

    • Node

      public Node​(String functionName, double power)
      This constructs a comprehensive node by parametrically setting its comprehensive function and power.

  • Method Details

    • setPower

      public void setPower​(double power)
      This configures the node actual power to the argument.

    • setPower

      public void setPower()
      This configures the node actual power to a stochastic power p, where minPower => p < 0.0 or 0.0 < p <= maxPower. By default, minPower = -1.0 and maxPower = 1.0, in accordance to the Pythagorean means configuration for the power mean. The following are required by the power mean to produce any of the Pythagorean means: For harmonic mean, p approaches -1.0; for geometric mean, p approaches 0; and for arithmetic mean, p approaches 1.0.

    • activate

      public void activate​(double parameter)
      This prompts the node to produce its hypothesis and thesis upon a scalar argument. The result of the node comprehensive function is the node hypothesis, and the node thesis is obtained by subtracting meanError from that hypothesis.
      See Also:
      CFunction

    • activate

      public void activate​(double... parameters)
      This prompts the node to produce its hypothesis and thesis upon a vector argument. The result of the node comprehensive function is the node hypothesis, and the node thesis is obtained by subtracting meanError from that hypothesis.
      See Also:
      CFunction

    • optimize

      public void optimize​(double objective, int iteration)
      This prompts the node to update its meanError. Given the two arguments: objective and iteration, an intermediate error is calculated, and this error is used to update the node meanError.

    • optimize

      public void optimize​(int iteration, double error)
      This prompts the node to update its meanError. The two arguments: iteration and error, are used to update the node meanError.
